questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to monitor and inspect large amounts of traffic and detect unauthorized attempts from inside the organization, with the help of an IDS. They are not able to recognize the exact location to deploy the IDS sensor. Can you help him spot the location where the IDS sensor should be placed?
//IMG//

discussion.content: Location 2
Location 2

Selected Answer: B
location 2 is
location 2 is correct

questions.question_text: Steven's company has recently grown from 5 employees to over 50. Every workstation has a public IP address and navigated to the Internet with little to no protection. Steven wants to use a firewall. He also wants IP addresses to be private addresses, to prevent public Internet devices direct access to them. What should Steven implement on the firewall to ensure this happens?

discussion.content: B. Steven should enable Network Address Translation (NAT)
Come on, the correct answer is B. Steven must enable NAT

Selected Answer: B
I think he should enable NAT

Selected Answer: B
I agree, I think it should be NAT
B.Steven should enable Network Address Translation (NAT)
B. Steven should enable Network Address Translation (NAT)

choices.A: Steven should use Open Shortest Path First (OSPF).
choices.C: Steven should use a Demilitarized Zone (DMZ).
choices.B: Steven should enable Network Address Translation (NAT).

questions.question_text: Assume that you are a network administrator and the company has asked you to draft an Acceptable Use Policy (AUP) for employees. Under which category of an information security policy does AUP fall into?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
CND Book P.187
SSSP directs users while configuring or maintaining a system

questions.question_text: During the recovery process, RTO and RPO should be the main parameters of your disaster recovery plan. What does RPO refer to?

choices.B: The hot plugging technique used to replace computer components
choices.D: The interval after which the data quality is lost
choices.A: The encryption feature, acting as add-on security to the data
choices.C: The duration required to restore the data

discussion.content:
The Answer is D: 

A recovery point objective (RPO) is the maximum time frame for which an organization loses data after a major IT outage. It determines the acceptable amount of data loss an enterprise can suffer in case of a disruption.

RPO is the maximum time frame for which an organization loses data after a major IT, C.

Data is lost not the data quality

Selected Answer: D
I think answer is D, CND Book, P. 2185

RPO is Recovery Point Objective and is the interval that passes before data quality is
lost.
RTO (the Recovery Time Objective), is a metric that defines the time to recover your IT infrastructure and services following a disaster to ensure business continuity.

i think is 
D. The interval after which the data quality is lost
Recovery point objective (RPO) is the maximum time frame for which an organization loses data after a major IT outage

Selected Answer: D
I think answer is D, CND Book, P. 2185
Kojoney is a low level interaction honeypot that emulates an SSH server.

Low-interaction honeypots: As the name suggests, low-interaction honeypots generally fake those services that are frequently asked by the attacker. They are essentially a single machine with multiple virtual machines.

questions.question_text: Ryan works as a network security engineer at an organization the recently suffered an attack. As a countermeasure, Ryan would like to obtain more information about the attacker and chooses to deploy a honeypot into the organizations production environment called Kojoney. Using this honeypot, he would like to emulate the network vulnerability that was attacked previously. Which type of honeypot is he trying to implement?
